item.title:
I am incredibly grateful to @Vetenskapsradet and @EMBO for supporting me with an international postdoc fellowship, and @StratNeuro for acting as my home institute in Sweden.
I will be using in vivo voltage imaging to study plasticity in the retrosplenial cortex, exciting stuff!

item.title:
On that note: because I am hosted by a Swedish institute but working in Norway, the tax/immigration situation has been... complicated.
I wanted to wait with updating y'all until that was resolved, but that seems to be taking a while yet.

item.title:
As for why I switched: while I really enjoyed working as an editor, I missed Scandinavia, and, more importantly, @Josje_vLunteren.
Berlin wasn't the place for me, but I had an amazing time working for @NatureComms, and can highly recommend it to everyone: you'll learn a ton!
item.description:

item.content:encoded: As for why I switched: while I really enjoyed working as an editor, I missed Scandinavia, and, more importantly, @Josje_vLunteren. Berlin wasn't the place for me, but I had an amazing time working for @NatureComms, and can highly recommend it to everyone: you'll learn a ton!

item.title:
I look forward to tweeting a bit more about ongoing science, and meeting you all at future conferences.

item.title: @KordingLab My take is that how we train students at all levels is a major factor in keeping science stuck in old ways. Students select psychology/biology (not always) because they don't like math/physics. And psych/bio is taught in totally archaic ways.

item.title: I wish I had spent more time thinking about the Heilmeier Catechism earlier in my life (although I think I always carried it in me). https://t.co/OPI1ETW9u0 I think keeping these points in mind can help all of us scientists think clearer.
item.description: I wish I had spent more time thinking about the Heilmeier Catechism earlier in my life (although I think I always carried it in me). https://t.co/OPI1ETW9u0 I think keeping these points in mind can help all of us scientists think clearer.
item.content:encoded: I wish I had spent more time thinking about the Heilmeier Catechism earlier in my life (although I think I always carried it in me). https://t.co/OPI1ETW9u0 I think keeping these points in mind can help all of us scientists think clearer.

item.title: In particular, the first four points should be answered by every paper: * What are you trying to do? Articulate your objectives using absolutely no jargon. * How is it done today, and what are the limits of current practice?
item.description: In particular, the first four points should be answered by every paper: * What are you trying to do? Articulate your objectives using absolutely no jargon. * How is it done today, and what are the limits of current practice?
item.content:encoded: In particular, the first four points should be answered by every paper: * What are you trying to do? Articulate your objectives using absolutely no jargon. * How is it done today, and what are the limits of current practice?
